name: AtomInvest
slogan: Democratising access to high-return private equity, venture capital & hedge funds
description:
AtomInvest (www.atominvest.co) is using technology to bring the alternative investment funds industry to the 21st century. 

We are democratising access to alternative investment funds and making the investment process simple, low-cost and transparent. 

Through our web-based platform, we aim to provide investors with the opportunity to invest into leading alternative investment funds (across private equity, venture capital, debt, real estate and hedge funds) in smaller investment amounts, via a simple and streamlined investment process.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Developer
jobs.description:
ROLE:

In this role, you will be largely contributing to the entire SDLC of the AtomInvest software stack through requirement gathering, design, implementation, testing, delivery and enhancements/support. You will closely work with the founders, to develop and optimise the architecture, build and delivery of the next generation alternative financial services platform.

You will have experience with web services, high available and scalable web platforms, databases, cloud services such as AWS and frontend web development. Using this knowledge and being part of the development team, you will be also be responsible for articulating technical choices and participating in the definition of the technology road-map. 

In return for your efforts, in addition to your compensation, we aim to provide an open, entrepreneurial and meritocratic working environment which will keep you engaged, excited and help you grow as an individual. 

EXPERIENCE:
- Minimum 5 years of experience (part or full time) working in cutting-edge technology environments, architecting scalable robust applications with a proven track of go live products
- Experience with financial / payment services companies such as banks, trading and securities services platforms is a plus

EDUCATION & PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES:
- Bachelor’s degree and/or college equivalent (preferred engineering, computer science or business degrees).
- English fluency required
- Self-starter, highly motivated and proactive individual
- Able to work closely in a small team
- Comfortable working in complex environments and under tight deadlines
- Good presentation skills with the ability to articulate technical choices to founding team
- Excellent documentation skills
- Able to legally work in UK / Europe

USEFUL & DESIRED TECHNICAL SKILLS: 
- Javascript (and frameworks such as AngularJS and ReactJS)
- HTML, CSS/LESS/SASS
- Scalable Web Software Architectures
- Git, MySQL, Amazon Web Services, Unix/Linux systems
- Scrum, DevOps
- Large-Scale Distributed Systems is a +
- Knowledge/experience of Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Zookeeper is a +
- Knowledge/experience of noSQL databases such as MangoDB or Cassandra is a +
- Quantitative Programming (trading / Quant. financial background) is a +


COMPENSATION:
The compensation structure / mix is negotiable for the right candidate.

jobs.title: Business Development Associate
jobs.description:
We are seeking to hire a Business Development Associate within our team to lead our sales and investor development efforts. You should be ambitious, extremely proactive and comfortable working in a fast-paced dynamic startup environment.  

You will work alongside the founders to build up the sales function of a business that is disrupting the private equity, venture capital and hedge funds space. You will also be required to work across different functional areas such as technology, fund management and operations and will be encouraged to continuously innovate and optimise our offering. 

You will be asked to demonstrate a track record of prior sales experience (1-6 years) within the financial services industry (ideally within private wealth, alternative investments, investment banking). 

You should have the drive, desire and tenacity to network, build and develop long-term relationships with a range of family offices, high net worth individuals, institutional investors and investment/asset managers across the world. 

In return for your efforts, in addition to your compensation, we aim to provide an open, entrepreneurial and meritocratic working environment which will keep you engaged, excited and help you grow as an individual. 

We aim to compensate fairly based on performance, with a fixed element combined with attractive sales-based performance incentives and potentially equity in the business. 

Role overview:

1. Leverage your deep understanding and strong relationships within your existing network of institutional investors, Family Offices, HNWI and private clients to introduce them to suitable investment opportunities through the AtomInvest platform 

2. Extend our existing network of investors by identifying, evaluating and bringing on board suitable new institutional investors, Family Offices, HNW individuals and wealth managers. Develop a deep understanding of their investment position and preferences to be able to identify investment opportunities of interest

3. Share knowledge of areas of focus and investments sought by AtomInvest’s investor base with the team to help tailor the pipeline of future investments

4. Source and evaluate opportunities to invest into alternative investment funds which are in the market

5. Gain understanding of deals we have within the AtomInvest platform to be able to outline and discuss the deals with relevant investors.

6. Record all updates, intelligence and correspondence with investors on our CRM system

7. Assist in the product development of our back-end client technology systems to continuously optimise our investor sales/business development processes

Prior Experience

1. 1-6 years-experience (full time) working in the financial services space with asset management firms, major investment banks, private banks or family offices

2. Relevant knowledge and experience of investment types (funds, direct investments, co-investments) within the Investment/Financial Sectors, preferably Real Estate, Private Equity, Venture Capital and alternative investments

3. Have a well-established existing network of Family Offices/Private Wealth/Asset Manager contacts (especially within UK/Switz/EU/M.East)

4. Proven history of sales / business development / account management

5. Ability to source and actively engage with UHNWI, investment decision makers from Top Family Offices, Asset/Fund/Wealth Managers & Institutional Investors

6. Previous evidence of revenue-generating experience such as sales/ business development/account management

7. Candidates related to the following will be relevant 
•	Experience in Family Offices / IR with focus on Family Offices
•	Family Office conferences/networks
•	Wealth Managers
•	Private Bankers
•	Other access & relationship with Family Offices
•	IR raising money for funds / Placement Agents


Personal Attributes Required

1. Motivated, self-starter, able to work autonomously and manage own day-to-day workload

2. Sales-focused attitude with a focus on closure and results

3. Excellent communication skills and ability to quickly develop deep relationships

4. Analytical, inquisitive person who seeks to further their understanding in all areas

5. Dynamic, energetic and confident individual

6. Team player, keen to share ideas and extend learning of themselves and others by sharing understanding of investors’ investment interests, facilitating mandating of relevant deals

7. Ambitious and keen to progress

6. Able to legally work in UK

jobs.title: VP - Finance & Operations
jobs.description:
**Only for candidates with Fund Accounting experience**

We are looking for an ambitious candidate to join our team as a VP in Finance and Operations. 

This is a great opportunity for someone who is looking for a high degree of responsibility and a breadth of experience across fund finance, operations, technology and legal areas of our business. 

You will work alongside the founders to build up the operational capabilities of a business that is disrupting the private equity, venture capital and hedge funds space. 

You will also be required to share insights and contribute across different functional areas such as technology, fund operations and business development so as to enable us to continuously innovate and optimise our offering.  

This is a broad role within a fast-paced environment allowing you to rapidly develop new skills. 

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

1.	Finance/ Fund Accounting – preparation and delivery of fund accounts, investor reporting, fund administration, statutory filings, tax reporting, legal set-up and monitoring of fund structures and cash management

2.	Operations – operational responsibilities include performing KYC/AML checks on investors, FCA reporting and oversight, payroll/ HR management and developing systems and processes to scale the business  

3.	Technology – working with the technology and product teams to develop automated systems to optimize finance and operational activities 

Your profile:
1.	Qualified accountant
2.	At least 2 years+ of relevant private equity fund finance experience (either from the PE industry or fund administration) 
3.	Self-starter, highly proactive and keen to learn
4.	Have excellent technical accounting knowledge and skills
